intro: Oreocharis sericea, commonly known as the silky oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or shaded environments, showcasing its adaptability to specific ecological niches. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its role in local ecosystems. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
